snippet: Though Chinese couples can finally legally have a second child, the decision to have another for most families comes down to math.
abstract: Easing of one-child policy in China may not lead to large population shifts as many families cannot afford second child.
lead_paragraph: Though Chinese couples can finally legally have a second child, the decision to have another for most families comes down to math.

headline.print_headline: Rules Ease, but Wallets Often Limit Family Size
headline.main: Costs, Not Just Law, Deterred Chinese Couples From Another Child
